headline: Mexico's president downplays Trump's threats
description: Though the US and Mexico signed a security agreement in September 2025, and drug seizures and arrests in Mexico have increased, on Thursday, Donald Trump floated the idea of strikes against Mexican cartels.

headline: Trump signs emergency order to protect US-held revenue from Venezuela oil
Bob Weir, Grateful Dead's founding member, has died at age 78
US announces 'large-scale' strikes against IS in Syria
description: The strikes carried out on Saturday were part of Operation Hawkeye Strike, which was launched 'in direct response to the deadly ISIS attack on US and Syrian forces in Palmyra,' US Central Command said in a statement on X, using an acronym for the jihadist group.

headline: When the damage caused by alcohol begins in utero
description: Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can trigger more or less severe neurodevelopmental and growth disorders. Recent studies also show that fathers' alcohol consumption prior to conception may play a harmful role as well.

headline: In Los Angeles, one year after the fires: 'I will only live here if the neighborhood is rebuilt to withstand fire'
description: One year after massive wildfires devastated the southern coast of California, residents are laser-focused on rebuilding. But as they weigh the need for speed against the desire to build back better, they confront questions about the best way to preserve their quality of life.

headline: 'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
description: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

headline: Moses with a selfie stick, Goliath at a weightlifting competition: How AI gives the sacred new life
Iran's bloody and concealed crackdown
Metric or imperial? Canada faces the everyday puzzle of weights and measures
Greenland's parties reject American rule after latest Trump threat
US oil majors show only moderate enthusiasm for Venezuelan oil, despite Trump's urging
Victor Hugo's lesser-known genius: Decoration
Syria strikes Kurdish area of Aleppo as fighters refuse to evacuate
Venezuela says in talks with US to restore diplomatic ties
Laurent Vinatier's release: Putin makes a gesture amid frozen France-Russia relations
EU-Mercosur agreement: Five key questions about where things stand
EU Commission considers enacting the EU-Mercosur trade deal before MEPs ratify it
Annika's conversion to Sufism: 'For years, I limited myself to practicing the whirling dervish dance, trying to convince myself that Islam did not interest me'
'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
description: Political analyst Hamzeh Safavi, whose father is an adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, discusses the abduction of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the US on January 3 in Caracas, and its impact on the Islamic Republic.

headline: The new luxury olive oils: 'Visitors come with the same curiosity as for wine'
description: Olive oil has gained a new status. Championed by Michelin-starred chefs, the ingredient is now treated with the same reverence as a fine vintage wine, reflecting a precious artisanal craft. A handful of French estates are distinguishing themselves, selling their extra virgin production at premium prices.

headline: Trump-Colombia tensions thaw after months of heated exchanges
description: After threatening and insulting Colombian leader Gustavo Petro, the US president unexpectedly invited him to the White House.

headline: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
byline: Béatrice Giblin, Céline Spector, Pauline Schnapper  and  Sylvain Kahn

headline: Roberto Saviano: 'Venezuela is not a narco-state, but a state that uses drugs as an instrument for the survival of those in power'
